observation: I can see a sign-up page with social login options (Google, Facebook, Apple) and an email signup form. The form has an email input field with placeholder 'name@email.com' and a red 'Sign up' button. As an elderly user, I should use the email signup option rather than social logins. The email field is large and clearly visible which is good for my needs.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user with limited tech experience, I prefer the straightforward email signup method over social logins which can be confusing. The email input field is clearly labeled and has good contrast. I need to enter my email address to proceed with the registration.
ux_issues: Social login buttons may be confusing for elderly users - email signup is clearer

outcome.visual_observation: Email input field shows the entered text 'ai.test.user@example.com' replacing the placeholder text 'name@email.com'. The field appears active/focused with the user input properly displayed.
